Julie is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of clothing to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en:
Flordiliza is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables & homemade snacks like rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years.

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy vegetables & raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordiliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. Mwanamisi operates a firewood selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanamisi will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase 2 carts of firewood for resale. Mwanamisi aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase 2 carts of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 59 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida.

Su historia comenzó hace 8 años la cliente comenzó con un fogón "para parrilladas" pequeño y con el transcurrir del tiempo y con la ayuda de d-miro se compra una carreta y vende hamburguesa y embutidos. En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace con su familia le ayuda con su negocio, no está casada, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 12, 6 años de edad.

Su sueño es poner otro carreta en otro lugar para tener más ventas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de comida  comprando carnes, panes, bebidas para hacer mas comidas rapida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 59, has many aspirations for her fast food sales business to prosper in the next few years.

Her story starts 8 years ago, when she had a small stove for grilling. With time and the help from D-Miro Bank, she was able to buy a cart and began selling hamburgers and sausages. Her family helps her with the business. She’s not married. She has 3 children, 10, 12 and 6 years old.

Her dream is to buy another cart and put it in another location to generate more sales. That’s why she wants the loan. She will invest it in her food business by buying meat, bread and drinks, that way she can make more fast food.

loans.use: buy meat, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is a 30-year-old married man. He has a son who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be social and respectful. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are women. He is also a Nissan driver (road racing) which increases his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of quality charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase charcoal for selling. Elly's business goal is to expand his charcoal selling business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with 2 children. He has a flower garden where he plants & sells flowers like daises. He has had this business for 6 years. 

He requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the flower garden. He has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Edilberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the flower garden

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  For more than 21 years, she has been raising and selling livestock. When they have fully grown, Xuraman offers them to butchers for sale. She raises them in a stall in the yard of her house. 

Xuraman is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which she will use to buy one cow for milk production. She believes that the cow will help increase her business. In the future she wants to increase her agriculture business and buy sheep for raising and selling.

loans.use: to purchase one cow for milk production.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  They reside in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs and poultry to sell for a profit to support the family. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Two of Mao's children are employed at the garment factory. Since the factory is far away for home, Mao is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children for commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her children until they get their bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Aissa Kane

texts.fr:
Madame   Aissa Kane est âgée de 37 ans, célibataire  et mère  de 1 enfant.  Elle vit chez ses parents   dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Sokala de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aissa Kane a abandonné l’école en classe de 9 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments, habits et chaussures. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle  décida d’évoluer seule  pour mener des activités de commerce général avec l’achat  vente de pommes de terre, d’habits, de chaussures, des fournitures scolaires à l’approche des rentrées des classes. Elle excelle dans ces activités depuis 12 ans et   jouit d’une grande notoriété et réputation. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 66 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 30 sacs de pommes de terres. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso et  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de nourrir sa mère et son fils  et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Son  ambition est de  construire  une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissa Kane is a 37-year-old single mother of one child. She lives with her parents in a large traditional family in the Ségou district of Sokala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Aissa Kane left school in the 9th grade of fundamental class (Malian educational system) to work alongside her mother selling condiments, clothing and shoes. After several years of training, she branched out to conduct her own business activity and started to buy and sell potatoes, clothing, shoes, and school supplies at the start of the school year. She is highly skilled, and has enjoyed great notoriety and reputation over the past 12 years. 

In order to bolster her working capital and increase her profits, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six and a half years ago. She received three group loans and four individual loans that were all correctly repaid. She is now seeking her 5th individual loan to buy 30 sacks of potatoes. She buys her stock in Sikasso and sells for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 CFAF, which will allow her to provide for her mother and her son, and to contribute to social events. Her goal is to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino, trabaja  todo el día como chofer propietario dentro de la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es el único ingreso para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el acabado de un muro en su casa, para dar más seguridad a su familia.
Marcelino es casado, vive con su esposa la cual vende verduras en un mercado y sus dos hijos en la casa de su suegra en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad del Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelino works all day as a driver with his own car in the city of La Paz.  This business activity is the only source of income to support his family.

He needs the loan for finishing a wall around his house in order to give his family more security.

Marcelino is married.  He lives with his wife, who sells vegetables at a market, and his two children in his mother-in-law’s house in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto.

This is the first time that he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to finish a wall around the perimeter of his house in order to provide greater security.

loans.name: Flor De Retama De Rumira Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Flor de Retama de Rumira” es un banco comunal  nuevo que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por  8 mujeres y 2 varones. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todas las socias tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad y viven en la comunidad de Rumira del distrito de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento  del Cusco.

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores, venta de maíz  y  venta de artesanía. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de vigilancia y costura.

(En la fotografía la socia Kenia está levantando la mano). 

La socia Kenia tiene 22 años y nació en la provincia de Ollantaytambo y vive en la comunidad de Rumira, ella vive junto con su pareja y tienen un único hijo de un año y dos meses. 

Su actividad económica principal de Kenia es tapizar muebles como por ejemplo sillas, sofás y otras más, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora sus productos.  En esta oportunidad Kenia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, tela, esponja, cola de carpintero y clavos.  Su sueño de Kenia es ampliar su negocio de tapicería en la ciudad del Cusco. 

(El socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso en día de la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Flor de Retama de Rumira” communal bank is a new one, pertaining to the “Asociacion Arariwa”. It is composed of 8 women and 2 men. The bank meets every 30 days and all the members have to be present at scheduled meetings. The majority of members are neighbors and friends who live in the community of Rumira, Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

The members are workers and entrepreneurs who seek opportunities at every moment to get ahead and through their daily efforts, to provide a better future for their children. The economic activities some of the members are involved in include, for example; selling vegetables, fruit, or groceries, raising small animals, selling corn, or selling their artisan crafts. Other members make dresses or work as security guards. 

In the photo, member Kenia may be seen raising her hand. She is 22 years old and was born in Ollantaytambo province, and resides in the community of Rumira. She lives with her husband and has just 1 son, aged 1 year and 2 months. Kenia's principal economic activity is upholstering furniture, including chairs, sofas, and other items. She has a small shop in her home where she makes her products. 

On this occasion, Kenia needs a loan to buy more work materials; for example, wood, cloth, sponge, wood glue, and nails. Kenia's dream is to expand her tapestry business in the city of Cusco.

(The member who appears in the lower part of the photo was excused on the day of the meeting.)

loans.use: buy work materials such as, for example, wood, cloth, sponge, wood glue and nails for upholstering furniture.

loans.name: Jose Nilo

texts.es:
José es un hombre que tiene 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su pequeño negocio de venta y reparación de baterías.

Empezó cuando él aprendió de su padre. Su padre vendía baterías y se dio cuenta que ahí tenía su futuro, como hace su trabajo pues bien el compra baterías usadas y las recarga para su funcionamiento optimo, su dificultades son los ladrones ya que las calles se han puesto peligroso no está casado, no tiene hijos, sus sueños son ya que él vive en la casa de su tía. 

Desea arreglar la casa porque su tía le ha enseñado todo lo que se sabe. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando baterias, herramientas etc.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and he has a lot of aspirations for helping his small business to prosper over the next few years.  His business is selling and repairing batteries.

José started out in this business when he learned it from his father.  His father used to sell batteries and he realized that this was where his future lay.  He buys used batteries and recharges them so that they work optimally.  The difficulties he faces are thieves as the streets have become dangerous.  José is not married and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his aunt's home.

José would like to fix up the house because his aunt taught him everything he knows.  He would like to invest his loan in his business, buying batteries, tools, etc.

loans.use: to buy batteries, tools, etc.

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en: Rizalde is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. He has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Rizalde hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for over ten years and earns approximately USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately USD 4 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Sokha is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business, rebuild her present house, and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell. Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and the mother of two children aged six and two. She sells clothing materials, a business she ventured into seven years ago, and she earns a monthly income of about KES10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she will use to purchase clothing materials to sell. The profit she earns from this business would help repay her loan.This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells bananas & vegetables like squash & cabbages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables & bananas to sell. Irene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад проживает в районе Бохтар. Он женат. Ему 58 лет. У него трое детей. Его старший сын таксист. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Бохтар - Кургантюбе. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для покупки запчастей.
texts.en: Ahmad lives in the Bohtar region. He is 58 years old, married, and has three children. His oldest son is a taxi driver. Ahmad provides a service - he transports passengers on the Bohtar - Kurgantube route. He has been working in this field for two years. He is taking this loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Faustina;  la socia tiene 51 años de edad; ella es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia tambien vende artefactos, zapatos de forma independiente la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de mercaderia para poder vender a sus clientes y seguir trabajando. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia.


La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” (Always Together); this bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in both the Province and Department of Cusco.

The associate is Faustina. She is 51 years old, and has a partner and 3 children. She buys and sells clothing. She also sells artefacts and shoes, independently. The associate wants to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to sell to her clients and be able to continue working.

The associate is grateful for this opportunity to receive a loan that will permit her to invest in her business and grow economically.

loans.use: buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma;  la socia tiene 49 años de edad; ella es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de hambuerguesas, sandwich, jugos, la socia tiene un kiosko en un colegio en el cual ella vende todo lo referente a productos de snack, gaseosas, dulces, galletas entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates e insumos para la elaboracion de los diversos sandwiches. 



La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” (Always Together); this bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in both the Province and Department of Cusco.

The associate is Vilma. She is 49 years old, and has a partner and 3 children. She makes hamburgers, sandwiches and juice. She has a kiosk at a school where she sells snacks, sodas, sweets and cookies, among others. The associate is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of items like cookies, soda, chocolates and ingredients for a variety of sandwiches. 

The associate is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan that will permit her to invest in her business and grow economically.

loans.use: buy cookies, soda, chocolates and ingredients for a variety of sandwiches.

loans.name: Edilma Nicolasa

texts.es:
Edilma es una mujer que tiene 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar su venta de ropa y articulos para cocina.

Su historia empezó desde que me separe de mi esposo sus mis hijos se quedaron pequeños. Tenía que salir a trabajar y empecé vendiendo artículos de hogar a crédito y comida rápida, su trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de los hijos, no tiene dificultades, esta separada de su marido, tiene 10 hijos

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio de venta de ropa y articulos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, articulos de cocina y otra parte de prestamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento para construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Edilma is a 44 year old woman who has many aspirations for helping her business to prosper over the next few years.  Her business is selling clothing and kitchen products.

Edilma's story begins when she separated form her husband and her children were young.  She had to go out to work and she started selling household goods on credit and fast food.  She carries out her work with the help of her children and doesn't have any problems.  She is separated from her husband and has 10 children.

Edilma's dream is to increase her business selling clothes and kitchen goods.  She would like this loan to buy clothes and kitchen goods.  She will also use part of the loan to buy blocks and cement so that she can build her home better.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products and clothing

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 15 per day. Additionally, she raises ducks to sell to generate more income to support the family. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns approximately USD 10 per day. All of her children are employed, two at the garment factory and another one is a construction worker. 

In order to develop her family economy, Oun is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to run a coffee shop to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to run a coffee shop to generate more income to support the family.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Nyagaza, who is in his mid 40's, is married with four children who go to school. He has been running a livestock business for 20 years now. He works from 2:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more goats and sheep, and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to still buy more goats and sheep to sell. His dream is to open a butcher shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Wito", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to add more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 55 years old, married and blessed with six children. He offers transport to the residents of Tala. He has been in this business for the last 6 years and gets an income of 11,000 KES per month.

Thomas has a good credit history in KADET LTD. He is applying for his fifth loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to add to his savings  and purchase a taxi.

He will use the extra profit to refinance back to the business. He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the future.

loans.use: to add to his savings to buy a taxi

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kameme is a 45 year old married woman. She has 2 children, 8 and 19 years old. Kameme describes herself to be social, honest and determined. She operates a general store where she sells charcoal, paraffin and kerosene. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Kameme's business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 36, is widowed and lives with her father and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working at a garment factory for over four years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. In order to generate more income and improve her family's living conditions, Sina is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy cattle to resell for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to buy more sows to breed so that she can produce more piglets to sell. She also plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger so that she can provide comfortable living conditions for her family and help her child to do well at school.

loans.use: to generate a larger income by buying cattle to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Review/daniel Muthama

texts.en: Daniel, a 42-year-old married father blessed with three children aged 16, 12 and 10 years, has owned a spare parts shop that earns him KES 150,000 per month for the past 15 years. Now requesting his fifth loan for KES 100,000 to help him purchase more spare parts as additional stock, he will reinvest the resulting extra profit into his business. Daniel's dream is to import more spare parts in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts as additional stock.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée de 40 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Secoura de la ville de Ségou. N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très tôt il embrassa le commerce de céréale auprès de sa maman qui vendait à la foire hebdomadaire de Konodimini. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage au côté de sa maman, elle évolua seule pour faire la même activité. Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité. elle vend sa marchandise au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femme. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 66 mois, après 5 prêts solidaire et 3 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés. Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 1 tonne de mil. Elle s’approvisionne à Konodimini.
Madame Mariam vend au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle. Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser le prêt et de diversifier ses activités en menant l’embouche ovine.
texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Secoura district of Ségou town. She has no formal education but instead started working at a very young age selling cereals at her mother's side at the weekly market in Konodimini. After several years apprenticeship with her mother, she started her own business in the same sector. She has been selling cereals for 15 years and has extensive experience in this line of work. Her high sales volume is due to her good understanding of how the sector works. She sells her merchandise for cash to a clientèle mainly made up of women.

Mariam is requesting this new loan in order to be able keep up with customer demand and increase her profits. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 66 months and has already fully repaid 5 previous group loans and 3 individual ones. She is on her 4th individual loan which she plans to use to buy 1 ton of millet. She gets her supplies in Konodimini.

Mariam sells her merchandise to her customers for cash or credit. With this loan, she anticipates being able to earn a monthly profit of 60 000 FCFA. The profits from her business will allow her to repay this loan and diversify her business activities and take up sheep-fattening.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Gradenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gardenia es una mujer de 43 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de joyas. 

Su historia comenzó por el año 1988 vendiendo cadenas bañadas de oro y plata actualmente vende en empresas y ambulante clientes que la conocen, su trabajo lo hace sola no tiene horario establecido puede salir en la mañana o por horas de la tarde, si tiene dificultades que le roben, no está casado, si tiene hijos de 11 años estudia en colegio particular

Su sueño es aumentar sus ventas y que sus hijo termine la secundaria. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de joyas y tener asi mas ingresos para vender a diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Gradenia is a 43-year-old woman who has many aspirations for helping her jewelry business to prosper over the next few years.

Gradenia's story begins in 1988 when she worked selling gold-plated chains.  She currently sells to companies and as an itinerant vendor to customers who know her.  She carries out her work alone and doesn't work fixed hours.  She is able to go out in the mornings or for a few hours in the afternoons.  Her difficulty is that people might mug her.  She is not married and has an 11-year-old son who is in school.

Gradenia's dream is to increase her sales and for her son to finish his secondary education.  She would like this loan for her jewelry sales business so that she can make more income and sell to different customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Firaddin

texts.ru: Firaddin jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On ochen lubit svoyu semyu i detey. Firaddin 42 qoda. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya skotovodstva i uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji. Firaddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, Firaddin seychas jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов.
texts.en:
Firaddin is married and has 4 children. He loves his family very much. Firaddin is 42 years old, and for the past 7 years he has been raising cattle. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to expand his business and to increase the quantity of dairy products he has for sale. Firaddin is an internally displaced person. He is a migrant from the city of Fuzuli, now living in the Fuzuli region together with his loving family.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Maricel is  a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 50 años de edad tiene una empresa de reciclaje en el municipio de Soledad, el cual inició hace 7 años cuando comprando hierro, aluminio, bronce, papel plástico y cobre le produjo buenos ingresos; con su negocio ha logrado comprar su propio vehículo, para transportar el material, con el que hace efectiva su labor; este ha crecido gradualmente, apoyado por los 4 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado comprar su vehículo y una carreta para recoger material.  Las ventas son al contado en bodegas mayorista de la ciudad de Barranquilla, sus proveedores son recolectores de los materiales reciclables en las calles de la ciudad. Su meta es lograr su crecimiento empresarial, comprando en mayor volumen y con las oportunidades que exige el mercado, para finalmente obtener su vivienda propia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que tendrá un dinero disponible para comprar Hierro, aluminio, cobre y papel plástico, ganarse el precio de la oportunidad y lograr en el futuro su mayor desafio que es emprender una sucursal de su negocio.
texts.en: Antonio is 50 years old and has a recycling business in the municipality of Soledad. He started the business 7 years ago when he bought iron, aluminum, bronze, plastic and copper and made good profits by recycling them. For his business he has been able to buy his own vehicle to transport the materials, which allows him to do his work more effectively. The business has grown gradually, with the support of the 4 loans he has taken out through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he used to buy his vehicle and a cart to haul the material. He sells the recyclable material for cash in a wholesale warehouse that is in the city of Barranquilla. His suppliers are collectors of recyclable materials in the city streets. His goal is to continue growing the business, to be able to buy in larger quantities and with the opportunities that exist in the market, be able to finally have his own storefront. He is currently requesting a loan to be used to buy iron, aluminum, copper and sheets of plastic. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity and achieve in the future his greatest challenge which is to open up a branch of his business.

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminum, copper and sheets of plastic.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and three children. For the last three years, he has run a shop where he sells variety of vegetables, including carrots and cabbages. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy new stocks of vegetables to sell to his customers. Ruben is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou est âgée de 42 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou. 
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’oignon apprise auprès de sa maman qui vendait des échalotes. Avec une expérience de 10 ans elle jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité. Elle vend sa marchandise au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femme. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois, après 1 prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 16 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.
Madame Oumou vend au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle. Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente de galette.
texts.en:
Oumou is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a nuclear family in the district of Hamdallaye in Ségou town. She did not go to school, instead becoming interested in revenue-generating activities at a young age, most notably the buying and selling of onions, which she learnt selling shallots at her mother's side. She has extensive experience in the sector, having been in the same line of work for 10 years. Her large sales volume is due to her good understanding of how the sector works. She sells her goods for cash to a clientèle mainly made up of women.

Oumou is requesting this new loan in order to be able to meet customer demand and increase her profits. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months, and is on her second individual loan, having fully reimbursed her first one. She will use her second individual loan to buy 16 cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies locally in Ségou.

Oumou sells her merchandise for cash or credit to her customers. With this loan, she anticipates being able to make a monthly profit of 40 000 FCFA. The profits from her business will enable her to repay her loan and undertake other revenue-generating activities, such as the sales of "galettes" (flat pastry cakes).

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 36 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda de balones de futbol.

Su historia comenzó hace algunos años empezó haciendo balones poco a poco empezó a independizarse y a adquirir sus propios clientes luego debido a eso implemento una pequeña empresa de venta de balones de futbol, su trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su hermana ello cose los galones todas las semanas tiene pedidos, sus dificultades es la delincuencia en el sector, está separada del marido, si tiene 2 hijos estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia para ella y sus hijos y mejorar sus ingresos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su negocio y su casa. En su negocio quiere comprar balones de todos los deportes y para su vivienda la escritura.
texts.en:
Nelly is 36 years old and has great dreams that her soccer ball store will prosper greatly in the next few years. 

The story of her business began a few years ago when she started making soccer balls. Little by little she began to become independent and gain her own customers and as a result she started a small business selling soccer balls. Her sister assists her in her business by sewing. She has orders that come in every week. One of the difficulties she has includes crime in the area. She is separated from her husband and has two children who attend the government school.  

Her dream is to have her own home for herself and her children and to improve her income. She is requesting a loan for her business and her home. She will use the money in her business to buy sports balls of all types and for her home to pay for the the deed to her house.

loans.use: to buy sports balls of all types and pay for the deed to her house.

loans.name: Chhork

texts.en: Chhork, 29, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the last six years, he has earned a living by running a motor taxi and earns about USD 2.5 per day. His wife is a garment worker and earns about USD 3 per day. Because his motorbike is very old, Chhork is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi. The new motorbike will run more smoothly and allow him to attract more customers and generate more income to support his family. In the future, he would like to buy a piece of farmland where he can grow crops and earn more income to provide his family with a better life. His goals are to support his children's schooling so they can all get a Bachelor's degree, and rebuild his house so that it will be stronger and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Melinda is  a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 42 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Juntos tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Jatumpampa. La siembra de diversos tubérculos es su principal actividad económica. Cuenta con sembríos de papa, maíz, olluco y alverja. Ya tienen 20 años dedicándose a esto, su amplia experiencia le ayudaron a ahorrar lo necesario para comprarse sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Pero confiesa que le faltan parcelas para sus sembríos por eso en cada campaña, alquila algunas tierras y de esa manera abastece su producción. L e gusta mucho su trabajo, eso le hace sentirse vive y muy tranquila sobre todo en estos momentos en los que se encuentra atravesando por problemas muy fuertes. Pero no se desanima, sabe que la vida continúa y quiere triunfar por sus hijos. En cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos a la capital del país, pero hay ocasiones en los que los mismo comerciantes llegan a sus cultivos para comprar las cosechas integras. Por otro lado cría animales como ovejas que vende cuando necesita y a veces para su consumo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Jatumpampa al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
42-year-old María is a modest woman.  She lives together with Juan, her husband of 23 years.  The couple have six children, five of whom still live with them in their own home, in the town of Jatumpampa.  María's main business activity is sowing tubers.  She grows potatoes, corn, olluco (a native tuber) and peas.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and her vast experience has helped her to save up the money she needed to buy her own farmland.  However, she admits that she needs still more plots of land for her crops and so every year she hires land and thereby enables her production.  María very much enjoys her work.  It makes her feel alive and very peaceful, above all right now when she is experiencing some very bad problems.  However, she does not become discouraged, she knows that life goes on and she would like to do well for her children's sake.  Every harvest time, María sells her crops in the country's capital.  However, sometimes the buyers come to her and buy her entire harvest.  In addition, María also raises animals such as sheep which she sells when the need arises and sometimes uses for her own consumption.  

Maria belongs to the 'Jatumpampa al Progreso' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support to make progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys belonging to her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Maria will invest the money she requested in buying natural fertilizers which she will spread over her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Mwanaisha operates a business selling lesos (also known as kanga, these are articles of clothing) from her home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and the local area women. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality. Her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanaisha will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more lesos for resale. Mwanaisha aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos for resale.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en: Bros, 24, is married and resides with his wife and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a garment worker for more than six years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. His wife is also a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Bros is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, he would save some money on his transportation expense for the family. In the future, he would like to run an animal husbandry business in order to generate more income for the family. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Nancy has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 43 years old, married and a mother of five children, ages 20, 18, 14, 12, and 9. She sells cereals, a business she ventured into ten years ago. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy bags of maize and beans to add to her inventory for sale. Her profit will help her repay her loan. Her dreams are to expand her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim, 43, is widowed and resides with a son and a nephew in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than five years, earning approximately 4 USD per day. Her son is a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day. In order to generate more income for the family, Rim is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a generator that she will rent out. In the future, she would like to expand her business by renting a store for selling her fruits. She also would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger in order to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina de 46 años de edad convive con macedonio de 46 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el mismo distrito de Pichari. Generosa y trabajadora así es Valentina, desde muy pequeña trabajo en la agricultura cultivando cacao, café, plátano y cítricos. Ya de joven viajó a la ciudad de lima con la finalidad de buscar mejores condiciones de vida en donde conoció a su esposo. Poco tiempo después las cosas se pusieron inestables por el mal momento que pasaba el país y decidieron volver a Pichari en donde ahora se dedican ambos al cultivo del cacao y café que son productos que tienen una demanda considerable en el mercado exterior.
Valentina está contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera una rentabilidad optima. En un futuro ella esta pensando seguir instalando más plantaciones de cacao con la finalidad de obtener mejores cosechas y mayores ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito, con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está contenta con su banco comunal por que son puntuales y solidarios. Con los 3,500 ella invertirá en la compra de plantas de cacao con la finalidad de incrementar su campo agricola.
texts.en:
Valentina, 46, lives with Macedonio, 46, and they have 3 children. They live together in their own house in the District of Pichari. Valentina is generous and hard-working. She’s been working in agriculture since she was very little, cultivating cocoa, coffee, bananas and citrus. When she was young, she’s travelled to Lima with the purpose of finding better living conditions, and there she met her husband. Soon after, things went badly in Lima because the country was going through political instability, so they decided to move back to Pichari. In Pichari, they began cultivating cocoa and coffee and both products are in considerable demand in the outside market.

Valentina is happy with her line of work because it generates an optimal return. In the future, she is thinking about cultivating more cocoa plantations in order to obtain better crops and better income. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she promises to pay it off punctually. She is happy with the communal bank because they’re punctual and supportive. With the loan, she would invest in the purchase of cocoa plants with the purpose of increasing her crops.

loans.use: buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura de 20 años  vive en Soledad y se dedica al comercio, actividad que inició desde el año 2009 ayudando a su padre en su negocio, del cual tomó toda su experiencia, aprendiendo desde lo básico hasta lo técnico en términos de ventas; con un pequeño capital se independizó e inició contacto con los diferentes conductores de rutas de buses de la ciudad a quienes ofreció productos para vehículos, como farolas, parasoles pellones, foros para timón etc. Con su negoció le ha ido muy bien ella vende a crédito y tiene 2 locales comerciales ubicados en 2 terminales  de buses de la ciudad, donde vende  de contado. Su meta mas adelante es extender su infraestructura hacia todas las terminales de buses de la ciudad, por eso se esfuerza trabajando persistentemente para lograrlo en un futuro, lo que es su máximo desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de lujos para vehículos, como farolas, stop, cornetas, parasoles, cintas led, cajas de monedas, pellones, forros para timón, lo que planea comprar al por mayor para obtener mejores descuentos y generar mas utilidades, porque ante la creciente demanda de estos artículos su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo. .
texts.en:
Laura is 20 years old and lives in Soledad. She makes a living working in sales, which she has been doing since 2009 when she began helping her father in his business. By working with him she gained all her experience. She has learned everything from the basic to the technical in terms of sales. With a small amount of capital she started a small business independently, by contacting different bus drivers on the city route and offering them products for their vehicles like headlights, sun shades and seat and steering wheel covers, etc.

Her business has done very well. She sells on credit and has two commercial locations, located in two different bus terminals in the city, where she sells her goods. Her goal for the future is to expand her business to be able to sell in all of the bus terminals in the city. She is working hard to be able to accomplish this in the future and achieve her biggest goal.    

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first loan that she has taken out through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy car accessories like: headlights, brake lights, horns, sun shades, LED lights, coin boxes and seat and steering wheel covers, which she plans to buy in bulk to get a better discount and have better profits. With the growing demand for these items, the working capital she has is not sufficient.

loans.use: to buy car accessories in bulk, like: headlights, brake lights, horns, sun shades, LED lights, coin boxes and seat and steering wheel covers.

loans.name: Ngo

texts.en:
Ngo is 59 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are employed. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been producing brooms to sell for over 10 years and are successful in their career. They earn approximately $3 per day.  

In order to improve her business, Ngo is requesting a loan for $800 to purchase a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and support her children to study until they earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children who attend school. She operates a food stall and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more stocks of beans, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil for her business. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality; her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Fatuma aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ort

texts.en:
Ort is married and has two children who are employed. She lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom, where agricultural businesses are common.  Ort operates a fish-selling business in a local market of the province. Her husband cultivates rice and he fishes. Together, this couple is able to earn approximately $4.00 per day to cover their daily expenses. 

Ort is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her two children to commute to their workplaces. In the future, she. aims to drive her family-owned businesses towards success.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Luque está integrado por mujeres que ya habían formado parte de otro grupo y por eso invitaron a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surge el grupo llamado los rosales. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
La Sra. Lucina es una de las integrantes, ella es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 41 años,tiene 2 hijos, esta casada con el Sr Wilfrido quien es constructor de obras. Ambos trabajan arduamente para poder ayudar a sus hijos, pues de esa forma podrán salir adelante y tener un mejor futuro. Lucina se dedica a la venta de comestibles, en lo cual le va muy bien, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de panificados, verduras, carnes y demás insumos para continuar en la venta de sus comestibles.
Agradece a kiva y a fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Luque, is made up of women who were already part of another group and invited their friends and neighbours to form this group: "Los Rosales". They are very hard-working and enterprising women who work hard to give their families everything they need for a dignified and respectable life.
Mrs. Lucina is one of the group members; she is the group president. She is 41, has two children, and is married to Mr. Wilfrido, who works in construction. They both work very hard to support their children so that they can get ahead and have a better future. Lucina sells food, and her business is going very well. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of baked goods, vegetables, meat, and other items so that she can continue to sell food.
She thanks Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Elias Stalin

texts.es:
Stalin es un hombre de 42 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller mecánico

Su historia comenzó cuando el trabajaba para una empresa y decidió independizarse ya que no le alcanzaba lo que ganaba ahora es muy conocido en su sector y tiene algunos clientes, su trabajo lo hace solo cuando tiene varios carros para arreglar llama a un ayudante, no tiene dificultades, no esta casado, no tiene hijos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia porque vive con su madre. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller mecánico y poder comprar herramientas para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Stalin, 42, has many aspirations for his repair shop business to prosper in the next few years.

His story starts when he was an employee at a company and decided to become independent since he was barely making a living. Now he’s very well known in his business and has a few clients. He works alone, but when he has many cars to repair, he hires an assistant. He hasn’t any difficulties. He’s single and has no children.

His dream is to own his own house, as he currently lives with his mother. He is requesting a loan for his repair shop, to invest in tools in order to improve the service to his clients.

loans.use: buy tools.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar  est un jeune homme de 31 ans qui vit dans l’une des localités villageoises du Sénégal.  Il s’active pleinement dans le secteur de l’aviculture et capitalise une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité. Il a choisi son activité par amour et passion. Il éprouve beaucoup de plaisir   a voir évoluer ses poussins, leur croissance et les bénéfices réalisés l’intéressent  beaucoup. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc depuis 2004. Il sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour  l’agrandissement de son activité.  Son crédit antérieur lui a permis d’acheter un réfrigérateur . Son objectif futur est d’élargir le maximum son poulailler.
texts.en:
Matar is thirty-one years old, and lives in a village in Senegal. He works hard in the agriculture sector and has 10 years of experience. He chose this line of work because he is passionate about it. Matar is very happy to watch his chicks change as they grow, and he likes the amount of profit he makes. 

Matar has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2004. He is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to expand his business. With his previous loan, he was able to buy a refrigerator. His goal for the future is to expand his hen house to the maximum.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to expand his activity.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and married with three children. He distributes water to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an electric water pump.

loans.use: to buy an electric water pump

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: Rosalinda de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a Víctor, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ahuaycha. Posee varias casas, “el trabajo duro”, es su lema. Por ello no descansa y realiza varias actividades que la ayudan a progresar. En la mañana realiza panes, en un horno artesanal que fabricó. Tiene un panadero que les ayuda. Con el auto que poseen su esposo traslada el pan a diversos caseríos y anexos de la zona. Asimismo tiene un ómnibus con el que realizan trasporte público en las rutas Acraquia – Pillo, dos anexos concurridos por su actividad económica, ahí contrata un chofer que junto a su hijo administran las ganancias, les va muy bien sobre todo porque no existe mucha competencia. Durante el día su nuera, se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de comestibles que puso en su casa, donde vende alimentos de primera necesidad. Además de los animales que cría, tiene gallinas de corral, grandes y saludables que comercializa en cualquier eventualidad, asimismo 100 cerdos que los distribuye en diversas casas pequeñas, separadas por adobe de acuerdo a la edad y al sexo, después de engordarlos los comercializa como carne cocinada llamada “lechón” , que es muy consumida en la zona. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rosalinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el monto para comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Rosalinda, 41, is a very hard worker. She lives with Victor, her husband of 23 years. They both have 8 children, but only live with 4 of them in their own house located in the annex of Ahuaycha. She owns various houses. Her motto is “hard work”, so she doesn’t rest. She has several lines of work that help her get ahead. In the morning, she bakes bread in the artisanal oven she built. She has a baker who helps them. With their car, her husband transports the bread to various townships in the area. They also own an omnibus that provides public transportation on the Acraquia-Pillo route, two townships that are well-travelled for economic reasons. They hired a driver from that area who administers the earnings with his son. That business does very well because there is almost no competition.

During the day, her daughter-in-law tends to the grocery store that they have in their house and where they sell everyday items. As well as the animals that they breed, they have big and healthy corral chickens that they sell at every possibility. They also have 100 pigs that they distribute in diverse small houses, separated by adobe according to age and sex; after fattening them up, they cook the meat and sell it as “lechon” (suckling), a food that is consumed in this area. 

This is the 4th loan from MFP, where she is happy to receive the financial support to get ahead with her business. She promises to meet her payments. Also, she’s happy to be a part of this association because all of the members are responsible and supportive. With the loan, Rosalinda will invest in the purchase of a house.

loans.use: buy a house.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar, trabaja en el área de salud como fisioterapeuta en una entidad publica de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar su tesis en la universidad y de esta forma tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Omar, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Omar works in the healthcare arena as a physical therapist for a public entity in La Paz city.

He is requesting the loan to pay for his university thesis, and in this way to earn more income to support his family.

Omar is single with no children.  He lives in his parents' home in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz city.

This is his first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of preparing his thesis for his university degree.

loans.name: Maricela Magdalena

texts.es:
Maricela es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta ambulante de productos faciales.

Su historia comenzó apenas cumplí la mayoría de edad debía yo tener sus propios ingresos, entonces penso en poner su negocio de venta de productos por catálogos, terapia y masajes gracias a mis conocimientos, trabaja sola y pongo en prácticas mis conocimientos todos los días, sus dificultades son los ladrones y el transporte, esta soltera y no piensa en casarse, no tiene hijos

Su sueño es tener un local de venta de productos por catalogo y ser directora de catalogo. Quiere el préstamo para su venta ambulante de productos y maquinas para su local de masajes.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 25-year-old woman who has many aspirations for helping her business to prosper over the coming years.  Her business is selling facial products as an itinerant vendor.

Maricela's business story began when she had just barely come of age.  She needed to make her own income and so decided to set up a business selling catalog products and offering therapy and massages, owing to her knowledge in this area.  She works alone and puts her knowledge into practice every day.  The difficulties she faces are thieves and transport.  She is single and isn't thinking about getting married.  She doesn't have any children.

Maricela's dream is to have a sales location for her catalog products and to become a catalog manager.  She would like this loan for her sales business and also to buy machines for her massage business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell and also machines for her massage business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma would like to borrow PHP 22,000 to fund her recycling business. The recycling business that she previously funded through NWTF continues to provide her the opportunity to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing brooms to sell for over ten years, earning approximately 1.50 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately 3.50 USD per day. One of her children is a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day.

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Oeurn is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her business, rebuild her present house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Mahinbonu

texts.ru: Махинбону родилась в 1990 году в семье служащих. В 1997 году поступила в средную школу №4 и успешно закончила. В 2008 году поступила в Политехнический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана на факультет технологии консервирования и пище- концентратов, в настоящее время является студенткой 4 курса. Она активная и целеустремленная девушка, участвует во всех молодежных студенческих мероприятиях. Среди однокурсников имеет хорошую репутацию. Махинбону запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mahinbonu was born in a military family in 1990.  She started a secondary school #4 in 1997 and successfully completed it.  In 2008, she was accepted to the Polytechnic Institute within the Tajikistan Technical University, to the department of conservation technology and food concentrates, where she is currently a fourth-year student.  Mahinbonu is an active and goal-oriented young woman, who participates in all student events.  She has a good reputation among her classmates.  Mahinbonu is requesting this loan to pay for her education.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Darnester

texts.en:
Darnester and her husband founded Spring Ridge Academy, a four-star day care for pre-school aged children in greater New Orleans.  They just opened a second facility in Westwego, Louisiana.  Darnester and her husband are truly devoted to improving day care in Southern Louisiana.  Their first facility is the only four-star rated day care in the area.

A true advocate for quality child care, Darnester points out that Louisiana ranks 49 out of 50 in the United States for quality child care.  She wants that ranking to change and is doing whatever she can to improve the quality of child care in Louisiana.  She is both a Louisiana Pathways Trainer (Child Care Career Development System) and an adviser to the Child Development Association (CDA).  Darnester's dream is to make Spring Ridge Academy a five-star facility and to achieve National Accreditation for her day care facilities.  She is well on her way to making that dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a fence around the day care center and to install a fire alarm system.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Ijevan. Laura works at a secondary school as a French teacher. Her husband fulfills private orders for furniture assembly and water pipe installation. 

Laura’s youngest son attends school; her middle son has recently finished serving in the Armenian army and now he is looking for a job; her eldest son is studying at Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch on 4th course in the economy department.  The education fee for a year is 260,000 AMD and  Laura is requesting a loan for 130,000 AMD, which she will use to pay for her son’s second term at University. Laura’s son is fully confident that on graduating from University he will find a good job and help support his family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education at university.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman has been engaged in vegetable selling for 29 years. She is a 53-year-old married woman and has four children aged 33 to 20.  Khuraman started her business with very small capital. Now she sells the vegetables in the old car that belongs her son.

She wants to increase her business and have more income from it to open her own fruit and vegetable shop. Khuraman is asking for 1,200 AZN to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Geivi

texts.es:
Geivi es una joven madre de familia de 28 años de edad y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su esposo en su casita construida con mucho trabajo, ubicada en un caserío rural en vía de desarrollo por lo que hasta ahora solo tiene el servicio de luz eléctrica, perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura ubicado a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo 
>
Geivi ha sido desde muy pequeña una persona de negocios por lo que ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de primera necesidad (bodega) y además a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado menor y aves de corral, para lo que ha acondicionado lugares estratégicos para el mantenimiento de sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, su esposo es quien participa a diario en cada uno de los negocios que manejan ya que los proyectos trazados los han asumido de manera responsable.
>
Geivi desea surtir más sus negocios ya que considera que hay demanda aun insatisfecha por lo que quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su bodega, compra de ropa y además de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así mejorar no solo la calidad de atención si no que también satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes. Todo este proyecto de Geivi le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida como también darle una buena educación a su menor hijo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
>
Geivi a pesar de ser una joven de 28 años se ha sabido ganar el respeto y cariño de todos sus vecinos quienes no dudan en dar buenas referencias sobre su persona.
texts.en:
Geive is a 28 year old young woman who has one child.  She lives with her husband in a little house that was built with a lot of work.  They currently live in a rural settlement on the path to development.  Up until now it has only had electricity. It is in the Tambogrande district, Piura province.  It is approximately three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Ever since she was very young Geivi has been a business person.  She now sells clothes and basic needs products (grocery store).  She also raises small livestock and poultry.  In order to do so she has set up strategic places behind her house to take care of his animals.

Geivi wishes to stock her businesses more.  She believes there is a still unsatisfied demand.  That is why she wants to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, buy clothes, and buy balanced feed to fatten the livestock.  That way she will not only improve the quality of care, but she will also be satisfying the needs of all of her customers.  All of Geive’s project will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.  It will also allow her to give her minor son a good education. 

In spite of being a 28 year old young woman, Geivi has known how to win the respect and affection of all of her neighbors.  The neighbors do not hesitate to give her good personal references.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store, buy clothes, and buy balanced feed to fatten the livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 43 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de Amadeo, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Norca y David a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chupaca. Durante las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos, en principal de su esposo quien trabaja en la gobernación de la zona, en construcción de obras, ahí obtiene un sueldo mensual. Después de ello se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, col y maíz. Que cuida con mucho esfuerzo, pues de ello dependen las ganancias durante el año. Ya tiene 15 años dedicándose a la venta de su cosecha en el mercado mayorista donde es muy conocida. Su mayor sueño es contar con sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que solo siembra en el de sus abuelos. Para ello trabaja sin descanso, también en la crianza de cuyes, gallinas que comercializa a buen precio y por las tardes vende maca, manzana y demás bebidas calientes en el parque de la ciudad, le va muy bien ya que en ese horario corre viento y hace frió por lo que muchas personas consumen las bebidas calientes que prepara. Ahora quiere en primer lugar terminar de construir su casa. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chamblachaca” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues le agrada ser parte de su asociación. Esther de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en cercar su casa y poner un portón grande.
texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and a very independent woman. She lives with her husband, Amadeo, whom she has been married to for 17 years. Together they have two children, Norca and David. The family lives together in their own home which is located in Chupaca. In the morning she gets up very early to prepare food, mainly for her husband who works in the area doing construction work, which is where he receives his monthly salary. After that she manages her crops of potato, cabbage and corn. She cares for them with much effort because she depends on them for income throughout the year.  She has 15 years of experience making a living selling her crops in the wholesale market where she is well known. Her greatest dream is to have her own land to farm, right now she is using her grandparents land.

She works without resting because she also raises guinea pigs and chickens that she sells for a good price. And in the afternoons she sells ‘maca’ (a root vegetable), apples and hot drinks in the city park. She does well because at this time of day there is a lot of wind and it is cold, so many people drink the hot drinks she has prepared.  

Now, principally she would like to finish the construction of their house. She is a member of the group “Chamblanchaca” and this is the fifth loan she has taken out through MFP, where she places much hope in small loans to help her accomplish her goals. She promises to be punctual with her payments. She is happy to be a part of her association. Esther, with your support, will invest the money she has requested to build a fence around her home and put in a large gate.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a fence around her home and buy a gate.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is 27 years old and lives with his sister and mother in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Western Mongolia. His sister is a college student and his mother is a nurse.

He started a transport business in 2008. He often delivers packages and goods with his truck in the city.  Also, he purchases salvaged cars from the neighboring areas and sells the spare parts of the cars. He plans to buy a salvaged car with the loan.

He is a really diligent guy who says that "I would like to purchase the car and sell the spare parts of it to make a higher income so that I can pay for my brother's college fee". The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT for the car for spare parts.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts

loans.name: Lawani

texts.fr:
Lawani est une femme  âgée de 27ans. Elle est mariée å un  mécanicien. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Lawani travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2007.  En plus de son activité de coiffure elle vend des mèches, tissages et des bijoux à ses clients. Elle exerce son activité dans un quartier de la place et achète ses produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Lawani a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de mèches, bijoux et autres.
texts.en:
Lawani is 27 years old and married to a mechanic. She has one child.

Lawani has been working as a hairdresser since 2007. As well as being a hairdresser, she also sells hair extensions, hair weaves and jewellery to her customers. She works in her local district and gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market.

Lawani has requested her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, jewellery and other products.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions etc.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad  es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 27 años. Como madre cabeza de hogar ella inició su negocio, para responder transversalmente a las obligaciones de su hogar, es decir generar ingresos mientras atendía las responsabilidades con sus hijos y las domésticas de su vivienda, así fue como después de pedirle a Dios guía para desempeñarse efectivamente, empezó vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas, que obtuvo a crédito y que a su vez distribuyó entre una clientela doméstica muy cercana, su familia, sus amigas y las recomendadas de estas. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido  y con ello su capital de trabajo, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la que ha recibido dos créditos, con los que ha podido como ella dice. “comprar mas y vender mas”. Su meta es lograr comodidades en su vida familiar y ampliar la cobertura de su negocio, cumpliendo con el desafío de administrar bien sus ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará perfumes, artículos para el hogar y de bisutería, para continuar otorgándoles crédito a sus clientes entre quienes distribuye su mercancía en cantidades que ellos puedan pagar y a plazos ajustados a sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Maria, age 53, is the mother of three children, ages 1 to 27 years old. As a single mother heading the family, she started her business to respond to her household obligations, that is, to generate income while she tended to her responsibilities to her children and carried out the domestic chores in her home.
